Module com.example.lms
Package com.example.lms

Class DatabaseConnector

java.lang.Object
com.example.lms.DatabaseConnector
public class DatabaseConnector extends Object
Since:
: 11-16-2024 Class: DatabaseConnector Provides functionality to establish a connection to a MySQL database. The DatabaseConnector class is responsible for managing the database connection using the MySQL JDBC driver. It retrieves the database connection details (URL, username, and password) from the DatabaseConfiguration class and uses them to establish a connection. The class handles exceptions that may occur during the connection process and ensures that the appropriate error messages are logged. Usage example: 
 
 Connection connection = DatabaseConnector.connect();
 if (connection != null) {
     // Perform database operations
 }

  • Method Details

    • connect

      public static Connection connect() throws SQLException
      Establishes and returns a connection to the database using the JDBC driver and credentials configured in DatabaseConfiguration.

      This method registers the MySQL JDBC driver and attempts to open a connection using the URL, username, and password provided by the DatabaseConfiguration. If a SQLException or ClassNotFoundException occurs, the error message is printed to System.err, and null is returned.

      Returns:
      a Connection object to the database, or null if the connection fails
      Throws:
      SQLException - if a database access error occurs
